Belgium: Yes. No reports for 2007, 2015 or after 2024
Mexico: yes -- certain years only have some documents not all, e.g., Evaluaion Reports on Social Development Policy has many years missing

Australia: No discontinuity, but very limited before 2017
Belgium: This is the Special Evaluation Office (SEO) operating as part of the FBS Foreign Affairs website (so again, looking at development)
Canada: The portal is run by the department of Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC)
Czechia: This evaluation page is part of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Website and only covers Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Aid policies
Denmark: Published by Ministry of Foreign Affairs
France: This evaluation page is published by Cour de Comptes (Supreme Audit Institution) which also covers evaluating govt policy
Greece: This evaluation page is published by the Hellenic Court of Audit
Hungary: This audit evaluation page is published by the Supreme Audit Office of Hungary; only includes summary reports
Iceland: This audit evaluation reports page is published by the National Audit Office of Iceland
Italy: each year reports evaluate the previous year
Japan: each year reports evaluate the previous year
Latvia: The State Audit Office conduct some of the audits in very similar content as policy reviews: e.g.: Is the implementation of the land reform expected to be completed in the near future? Does the energy policy governance established in Latvia ensure effective decision-making for the development of the energy sector and crisis management? Has the Ministry of Agriculture acted legally according to its development plans and in a meaningful way when creating its network of electric vehicle charging stations?
Netherlands: The most recent evaluation completed is in 2025, but they have annoucned a number of other reports (up to 2032) which are not complete
New Zealand: Published by Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
Portugal: Evaluation study database for 2010-2019, transition to more tailored content in 2022
United Kingdom: Inconsistent but massive backlog of evaluations added since release, discontinuities possible but unlikely with scale.
Finland: Published by Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Israel: search for reports in the Israeli government website publication database
Slovenia: Published by National Audit Office of Slovenia
Turkey: commision reports for the next 5-year plan reviews previous one --> omitted the first 5-year plan
Germany: There is no tool to search by date/year, so discontinuity is unknown

Assessment Criteria: 2.1 Number of policy areas covered (out of 10 COFOG categories)

Canada: General public services, economic affairs, housing, education, social protection
Costa Rica: Seems to be all excluding defence
Greece: Health, general public services, social care, treasury, education
Hungary: Health, general public services, treasury, social care
Ireland: health, environmental, general public services, education, economics, defence
Lithuania: general public services; health; economic affairs; education; recreation, culture and religion; social protection; public order and safety
Poland: Health, general public services, economic affairs, education, environmental protection, social protection
Spain: General public services, social protection, housing and community amenities, health, environmental protection, education, recreation culture and religion, economic affairs

Australia: Only COFOG policy area which is less clear is housing, but I think this comes under "Built Environment" and "Social Issues"
Austria: The portal only focuses on development
Iceland: Annual national audit accounts are published 2 years after the year of reference (i.e. the national audit accounts for 2023 were only published this year)
Italy: external links to: The Italian Anticorruption Authority, National agency for the evaluation of universities and research (ANVUR), National Agency for Regional Health Services (AGENAS)
Japan: also a section about their research into policy evaluation practices in other countries
Luxembourg: only exists for Directorate for Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Affairs; years excluding NGO evaluations
Mexico: CONEVAL is in dissolution process as a department; The Budget Transparency portal from The Ministry of Finance and Public Credit is more like audits
Portugal: News, analysis notes, methodological guides, diverse resources etc...
Turkey: Announcements, e.g..: Weekly Developments and General Outlook in Turkish Economy
Germany: Although DEval has a number of evaluation categories, they all fall under development cooperation

Austria: No. There is one for website homepage, but not for the actual evaluation reports page.
Belgium: No. There is one for website homepage, but not for the actual evaluation reports page.

Australia: There is an "Easy English/ Eassy Read" Filter in the collection browzing page
Canada: Large print, braille, MP3 (audio), e-text and DAISY formats are available for most reports, but you need to request them
Japan: voiceover -- but not working; language options
Latvia: easy read mode, font size adjustments, colour contrast adjustments, text magnifier, screen mask, voiceover on cookies
Lithuania: font size; high contrast; B&W mode;  diable photos
Netherlands: It has an accesibility link and statement proving that it passes regulatory requirements
Sweden: Recent reports available in both HTML and accessible PDF form
United Kingdom:
change colours, contrast levels and fonts
zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)

Italy: layout to crowded: font too small

Belgium: No - although one report has a video
Netherlands: Yes, on the portal explanation and toolbox pages
Yes, on the portal explanation and toolbox pages

Japan: visualisation tools for database on spending and budget by departments

Assessment Criteria: 3.11 Summaries available on the portal (not as a part of the main documents)
Austria: Yes, but not all - predominantely recent publications. Reports from 2017 onwards have a clear options for each report: evaluation brief, main report, annexes, executive summary, infographic and management response
Costa Rica: Yes, but they are very brief

Ireland: yes -- Irish Governmnet Economic and Evaluation Service (IGEES) Publications
Lithuania: yes, but not just policy evaluation

Assessment Criteria: 3.13 How separate portals organised (if no central)
Czechia: Ministries (only exist for Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Finance)
Hungary: On the Supreme Audit Office website
Luxembourg: only in the Directorate for Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Affairs
United States: Each department responsible for own evaluations
Finland: Each department publishes its own evaluations
Israel: in the publication database in gov.il

Assessment Criteria: 3.14 Independent website rather than subtab of another website?
Germany: Yes (note, DEval is mandated by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ))

Australia: Very good, but could benefit from larger text option and interactive features. Excellent “evaluation toolkit” section, explaining what evaluations are.
Austria: The ADA (Development) portal is in association with the BMEIA (Austrian Foreign Office) (i.e. many reports are carried out together), but they have separate websites
Canada: Decentralised, but the standards set for reports are centralised
Japan: central portal hosts all evaluations but also redirects to each ministry hosting specific policy area evaluations
Mexico: CONEVAL (National Council for the Evaluation of Social Development Policy): only for social policies
Poland: All evaluations accessible through central government website under relevant ministry. Search required
Portugal: Very well presented, highly intuitive site to use and navigate
Spain: Just a collection of report documents
Sweden: Fully navigable and well presented site with highly transparent and detailed explanations
Switzerland: Full, well navigable database but nothing in the way of extra presentation or features
United Kingdom: Full, well navigable database but nothing in the way of extra presentation or features
United States: Page linking to each department's annual evidence plan and evaluation policies

Australia: 7,607 published from 2022 onwards. Mulptiple publications each month
Austria: Tend to be around yearly, sometimes slightly more regular
Netherlands: Very high frequency (rolling, as soon as evaluations announced)
Portal includes filter for the status of a report (announced, completed, cancelled, postponed, in progress)

Sweden: The Swedish Agency for Public Management
Switzerland: Search for evaluations in the Aramis database
